reports.suggestion_message:
to solve this problem, you can try the following approaches:

- update to a newer version to see if the issue has been fixed
  - redis v0.24.0 has the following newer versions available: 0.25.2, 0.25.3, 0.25.4, 0.26.0, 0.26.1, 0.27.2, 0.27.3, 0.27.5, 0.27.6, 0.28.0, 0.28.1, 0.28.2, 0.29.0, 0.29.1, 0.29.2, 0.29.5, 0.30.0, 0.31.0, 0.32.0, 0.32.1, 0.32.2, 0.32.3, 0.32.4, 0.32.5, 0.32.6, 0.32.7, 1.0.0-alpha, 1.0.0-alpha.1, 1.0.0-alpha.2, 1.0.0-rc.0, 1.0.0-rc.1, 1.0.0-rc.2, 1.0.0-rc.3, 1.0.0-rc.4, 1.0.0-rc.5, 1.0.0, 1.0.1, 1.0.2, 1.0.3

- ensure the maintainers know of this problem (e.g. creating a bug report if needed)
or even helping with a fix (e.g. by creating a pull request)
  - redis@0.24.0
  - repository: https://github.com/redis-rs/redis-rs
  - detailed warning command: `cargo report future-incompatibilities --id 1 --package redis@0.24.0`

- use your own version of the dependency with the `[patch]` section in `Cargo.toml`
For more information, see:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/overriding-dependencies.html#the-patch-section

per_package.redis@0.24.0:
The package `redis v0.24.0` currently triggers the following future incompatibility lints:
